<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L665">property <b>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls the action to take
on virtual machines if an APD status on an affected datastore clears in the
middle of an APD event. Can be one of `none` or `reset`. Default: `none`.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L673">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponse</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected loss to all paths to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`,
`restartConservative`, or `restartAggressive`.  Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdResponseDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L680">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Controls the delay in minutes
to wait after an APD timeout event to execute the response action defined in
`haDatastoreApdResponse`. Default: `3`
minutes. <sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastorePdlResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L688">property <b>haDatastorePdlResponse</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected a permanent device loss to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`, or
`restartAggressive`. Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L693">property <b>haEnabled</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Enable vSphere HA for this cluster. Default:
`false`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastoreIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L700">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The list of managed object IDs for
preferred datastores to use for HA heartbeating. This setting is only useful
when `haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy` is set
to either `userSelectedDs` or `allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L707">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The selection policy for HA
heartbeat datastores. Can be one of `allFeasibleDs`, `userSelectedDs`, or
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`. Default:
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostIsolationResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L714">property <b>haHostIsolationResponse</b></a>

<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHostIsolationResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The action to take on virtual
machines when a host has detected that it has been isolated from the rest of
the cluster. Can be one of `none`, `powerOff`, or `shutdown`. Default:
`none`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L720">property <b>haHostMonitoring</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Global setting that controls whether
vSphere HA remediates virtual machines on host failure. Can be one of `enabled`
or `disabled`. Default: `enabled`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmComponentProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L727">property <b>haVmComponentProtection</b></a>
</h3>

{{% md %}}

Controls vSphere VM component
protection for virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `enabled` or
`disabled`. Default: `enabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmDependencyRestartCondition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L737">property <b>haVmDependencyRestartCondition</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmDependencyRestartCondition?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The condition used to
determine whether or not virtual machines in a certain restart priority class
are online, allowing HA to move on to restarting virtual machines on the next
priority. Can be one of `none`, `poweredOn`, `guestHbStatusGreen`, or
`appHbStatusGreen`. The default is `none`, which means that a virtual machine
is considered ready immediately after a host is found to start it on.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmFailureInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L743">property <b>haVmFailureInterval</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmFailureInterval?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

If a heartbeat from a virtual machine
is not received within this configured interval, the virtual machine is
marked as failed. The value is in seconds. Default: `30`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L752">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumFailureWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `haVmMaximumResets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumResets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L757">property <b>haVmMaximumResets</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumResets?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The maximum number of resets that HA will
perform to a virtual machine when responding to a failure event. Default: `3`

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMinimumUptime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L763">property <b>haVmMinimumUptime</b></a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmMinimumUptime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The time, in seconds, that HA waits after
powering on a virtual machine before monitoring for heartbeats. Default:
`120` (2 minutes).

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L769">property <b>haVmMonitoring</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmMonitoring?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The type of virtual machine monitoring to use
when HA is enabled in the cluster. Can be one of `vmMonitoringDisabled`,
`vmMonitoringOnly`, or `vmAndAppMonitoring`. Default: `vmMonitoringDisabled`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmRestartAdditionalDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L775">property <b>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Additional delay in seconds
after ready condition is met. A VM is considered ready at this point.
Default: `0` (no delay). <sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmRestartPriority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L781">property <b>haVmRestartPriority</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartPriority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L489">property <b>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold</b></a>

{{% md %}}

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should
only be set if `sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold` cannot make an accurate
estimate of the capacity of the datastores in your cluster, and should be set
to roughly 50-60% of the worst case peak performance of the backing LUNs.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

{{% md %}}

The threshold, in
percent, of actual estimated performance of the datastore (in IOPS) that
storage DRS uses to make recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore when
the total reservable IOPS exceeds the threshold. Default: `60` percent.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterState-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L346">property <b>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold</b></a>

{{% md %}}

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should
only be set if `sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold` cannot make an accurate
estimate of the capacity of the datastores in your cluster, and should be set
to roughly 50-60% of the worst case peak performance of the backing LUNs.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

{{% md %}}

The threshold, in
percent, of actual estimated performance of the datastore (in IOPS) that
storage DRS uses to make recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore when
the total reservable IOPS exceeds the threshold. Default: `60` percent.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

this resource are used for virtual machine monitoring. The default is `true`

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-hostSystemId">

An optional [managed object reference

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-latencySensitivity">

Controls the scheduling delay of the
virtual machine. Use a higher sensitivity for applications that require lower

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-shutdownWaitTimeout">

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-vapp">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1356">property <b>vapp</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Optional vApp configuration. The only sub-key available
is `properties`, which is a key/value map of properties for virtual machines
imported from OVF or OVA files. See Using vApp properties to supply OVF/OVA
configuration for
more details.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1364">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`waitForGuestNetTimeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1373">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `waitForGuestIpTimeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1382">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`waitForGuestIpTimeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
</div>

The amount of time, in minutes, to wait
for a graceful guest shutdown when making necessary updates to the virtual
machine. If `forcePowerOff` is set to true, the VM will be force powered-off

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1007">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`waitForGuestNetTimeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1016">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `waitForGuestIpTimeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/a0e9f3f394ad39c7a129cd597da7a4271e4a9cfd/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1025">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`waitForGuestIpTimeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
</div>
